reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: “I absolutely felt at home here — the comfortable beds and finely decorated rooms made relaxing simple. The entire manor is kept up beautifully as are the acres upon acres of meadowland — take a stroll through the nearby fields and woods, or simply indulge in one of the UK’s best spas. Perfect for weddings or celebrating anniversaries and birthdays with loved ones. The whole family can enjoy all that is on offer — like the kids Playzone and the Mez, which offers movies, gaming consoles and a small cinema. There are also rooms set up just for families. And nothing beats sitting in the outdoor hot tub, sipping a glass of champagne and watching the sun go down after a day exploring the beautiful countryside."
reviews.title: Delightful Setting, Wonderful Stay

Excellent stay with small children
reviews.text: We loved our stay at Calcot Manor with our 3 year old and 3 month old. We stayed in a family suite which was very nice, really lovey decor, very comfortable, very high quality furnishings. And a lovely big bath! Breakfast in the conservatory was excellent, a real highlight, great way to start the day. Food at the Gumstool Inn was slightly hit and miss, but overall ok. We didn't like the decor of the Gumstool so much, it feels a bit new and not much character as pubs go, not really as good as the rest of the hotel. But children's tea there was excellent. The spa is lovely, we both had massages there which were very good. The children's playground is small but adequate. We put our children in the crèche a lot and were very happy with it and the staff there were lovely. The pool was great, we didn't have a problem with the set times for children's swimming and they provide lots of toys for the pool. Dinner in the conservatory restaurant was very good indeed. There is lots to do within a 15-45 minute drive. We visited Tetbury a few times (some great clothes shops!), Cirencester which was beautiful, Castle Combe was a gorgeous village to wander round, and we took the children to Bowood House & Gardens which has absolutely amazing grounds and a fantastic adventure playground - highly recommended. We also had lunch at Hunter Hall, a pub just around the corner with a big garden and great playground. We walked the trim trail at Calcot Manor, a nice easy stroll, though at one point lots of nasty bugs! We had a lovely overall stay there and would recommend it to those with small children who want somewhere nice for themselves as well. The staff overall were very young and occasionally green, but that didn't matter as they were extremely friendly and eager to please.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I have grown with Calcot Manor from the late 80's when Michelin stars and cloches were all the rage to the present day, they respond to trends staying fresh and interesting, the bedrooms are to die for, the food amazing in both the Conservatory and the Gumstool Inn and the Spa is a WOW, the service throughout is fabulous. We now live in Devon and don't get there as often as we would like to, but when we do it's like rapping yourself in cotton wool - big deep breath - and relax - love it love it love it
reviews.title: Amazing Journey

reviews.text: This hotel is fantastic!!! I went with my Mum and my 2 yr old daughter. The place was so freindly and so aimed at children. There is a playzone where parents can stay or leave their child which was lovely as my daughter doensnt like to be left. The whole place has a very relaxing feel about it. At breakfast time there are bibs and crockery especially for children and there is a high tea served at half 5 for children which is excellent food that my daughter really enjoyed. The spa was fantastic, where I had a great massage and you can take your children swimming (at a certain time of day). The gym there is small but great equipment. Only had a very slight problem, of once ordering a drink and it never coming, asking for assistance from reception and it not coming so having to ask again, and having to ask twice for our dinner trays from room service to be collected. But all of this doesnt really matter as the place is so fantastic. We stayed in a Woodchester which has a serperate room for the children, the whole room upstaris is a massive double bathroom and the bedroom was huge!! The only thing that I could say is that as my daughter is only two, the floors are quite slippy as they're wooden and so are the steps so I couldnt keep her socks on as she kept slipping. Brilliant two night break - wish I was there for longer!! Cannot wait to go back!!!! Oh and breakfast is also AMAZING!!!!
reviews.title: Excellent!!!!

reviews.text: Stayed in the hotel for a family wedding and loved it. The rooms were beautiful! Ours had the most fantastic shower and an extra large bath - and the lighting throughout was perfect. We also saw a few of the other rooms occupied by relatives and they were just amazing. Lots of lovely little touches - a flask of chilled water left in the room for the evening was very much appreciated. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful too. My only regret is that I forgot to pack a swimming costume for enjoying the spa fully (don't make this mistake!), although I did go for a jog on the running route through the gorgeous countryside - and had an excellent scalp massage. Oh and the food was delicious too! I suppose one tiny little complaint was that during breakfast we had to chase up our order as the waiting staff seemed a bit run off their feet and apparently forgot about us. But a minor complaint really from an otherwise amazing stay.
reviews.title: Stunning hotel, fantastic service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is little to criticise here - good food, very friendly and helpful, fantastic spa, good location and outdoor leisure options. However, this is a VERY family orientated hotel. It is a successful family formula. If you are a couple you may wish to try their sister hotel to avoid crying/whining children at breakfast, lunch, and dinner. The non-fine dining “pub” is a main family focus.
reviews.title: A very good FAMILY hotel and spa

reviews.text: Far away from me but I would go back... I went here for a business meeting with colleagues and we were there a couple of days...and what can I say the staff were excellent the business facilities were great and it worked really well for us...
reviews.title: Business but relaxing...
Rooms are lovely
reviews.text: But what I loved were the rooms and the breakfast; well decorated and clever designs made them stylish and comfortable at the same time - superb show and beautiful design to the bathrooms impressed as did the restaurant. Can't say I was blown away by the food, it was good but not great but breakfast was tasty and wide selection with friendly staff so not too much to bother you really.

Would I go again, yes definitely, was it somewhere I might take my wife instead of just for work - definitely and was I maybe a little distracted by all the work and didn't get to try all the facilities definitely so maybe my judgement on the food was business critical; try it for a relaxing weekend is my next thought.
